item.title: Wpad Security
item.description: What is WPAD?WPAD stands for Windows Proxy Auto-Discovery. It is a protocol to obtain the URL for a PAC file. WPAD uses the following methods in order to discover the PAC file URL: DHCP DNS WINS LLMNR NetBIOS Hosts Lmhosts The PAC file tells the host where to direct network traffic. This is usually used to force traffic through a web proxy. Why is it insecure?When DHCP or DNS is misconfigured or not configured, an attacker can provide the client with a PAC file that directs traffic to a compromised server.
